## Final Products {.smaller}

**Paper**

- Actual empirical study with real world data
- 5-10 pages
- Structure: 
    - Abstract
    - Description of data
    - Exploratory/descriptive analysis including charts
    - Hypotheses tests
    - Summary
- Submit .Rmd and .html or .doc files (i.e. fully reproducible documents)

\
**Presentation**

- 10 minutes
- Submit .Rmd and .html files


## Your Benefits

>- Prove that you can complete a real world empirical study using actual (messy) data
>- Master complete work flow: data access, data cleaning, analysis, visualization, data products
>- Know how to create fully reproducible data products
>- Learn a programming language (R) and an authoring language (markdown)

## Recommended Reading

1. David Diez, Cris Barr, and Mine Çetinkaya-Rundel (2014).
    **Introductory Statistics with Randomization and Simulation.**   
    A free PDF version is available at www.openintro.org.  

2. Nina Zumel and John Mount (2014).  
    **Practical Data Science with R.**   

3. Pervez N. Ghauri and Kjell Grønhaug (2010).   
    **Research Methods in Business Studies.**   
    Some copies are available in the JKU library.  

4. Alternatively, for German speakers:  
    Johannes M. Lehner and Alois Farthofer (2012). **Evidenzbasiertes Management.**
